title: Top 3 Shooting Spotting Scopes For The Money (Gordon Newman)
text: By Gordon Newman Oct 16, 2015 Spotting scopes have always proved to be an essential addition whether it is hunting or even range target practices. With an array of usage for outdoor lovers, the three spotting scopes mentioned below are some of the best shooting spotting scopes available in the market right now. These won't burn a deep hole in the pockets; yet perform delightfully across one's entire checklist.Alpen spotting scopes:The Alpen spotting scopes are available in both straight eyepiece and angled variants. The angled variant has a 45 degree angular eyepiece and mostly photographers and birdwatchers use them. But for target shooting and game hunting straight scopes may be the best selection since one may need to put them close to the eyes without much movement. This is though a personal choice. Coming back to the scope, it offers a brilliant 15x to 45x to even 60x magnification. Generally high magnification devices within low budget ranges are thought to be not as clear or brilliant at higher magnification. With multi-coated optics and the application of BAK 4 prism technology, the images are crisper, brighter and detailed. The design aspect of the Alpen scopes says all about what it can do. The Nitrogen sealed scope ensures that it is waterproof, fog proof and even dust proof. The scopes also claim to be shock proof. The spotting scopes come with retractable sunshades for usage during those bright sunny days. The other features include its light weight of only about (27 ounces), compactness and ergonomic factors.Redfield "Rampage" Spotting Scope:The redfield rampage delivers up to the mark performance within a low budget. While a high magnification is an attractive number to look at, this device offers 60x magnifications from 20x as starting range. The 60mm lens with respectable eye relief also comes with multi-coated optics and premium bak 4 prism technology. This enhances and clarifies imagery. Though heat waves and distortions are normal at higher magnification even with high end device, this device also offers similar quality of imagery. Rampage is fully "field ready" with its rugged design and water proof and fog proof technologies. The field of view is optimal in this device, contrary to having very high magnification power. The lightweight factor of the device is due to the poly carbonate body which also is extremely durable. It comes with a tripod adapter and can also be mounted on windows. Supplied accessories include a clear soft case, neck strap, lens cover and a tripod.Barska "Colorado" spotting scope:One of the best value for money scopes available in the market, the Barska "Colorado" raises the bar in packing great feature at hugely competitive pricing. The 60mm straight spotting scope has a magnification range of 20x to 60 x. Field of view is standard compared to similar devices and measures 30 feet at 1000 yards. While the close focus distance remains at only 7 meters. This combination of viewing abilities and numbers suggest a strong developmental attempt in the backstage of the device's workshop. This is a fully waterproof and fog proof device and is prepared for rugged usage in most terrains. The BK 7 lens system, with multi-coated optics, renders clear images even at low light conditions. All in all, this device is a great starter spotting scope for aspiring hunters and birdwatchers.No matter what one's skill can offer at the moment, to improve, one needs data. Using a spotting scope provides the required data with accuracy and saving time. In hunting scenarios, a spotting scope is important. Since a spotting scope is best selected as a choice of lifetime, it is better to opt for the best shooting spotting scopes available. One should not restrain their budget too much but if in need, the above three are the best spotting scopes available at the moment. These are feature proof and also come within a reasonable price bracket. About the Author Gordon Newman, is a blogger at HuntingBackpackReview.com , it's a web portal providing info regarding Hunting Gear; to make sure hunter can decide to buy the best shooting spotting scopes and Hunting Gear available on the market.
